Update pretty_env_logger requirement from 0.3.0 to 0.4.0 in /gdb-server

title: Add file based config for dependabot
Update all dependencies and fix deprecation warnings for hidapi
Revert PR #150
body: Revert the changes in PR #150 , they break flashing on a STM32WB55 board.

title: Add support for STM32WB55, small fixes for multiple AP support
body:
Add support for the STM32WB55 chips.

Also fixes some small issues with support for multiple APs which I found while using them.
It also includes initial support to read the TARGETID, which is only present on DP version 2.

title: Add SWD support for JLink
body:
This PR adds SWD support for the JLink.

It seems to be working well with M4s and seems to have issues with some M0s.

I think we can still merge it like this and fix the issues later. What do you think?

title: Fix page count calculation
body: The old version failed me with the STM32L071 :wink:

title: Add Cortex-M3 support by re-using Cortex-M4
body: The architectures are identical enough to just reuse the M4 module.

title: Add STM32L0xx target
body:
Generated with target-gen using
https://keilpack.azureedge.net/pack/Keil.STM32L0xx_DFP.2.0.1.pack

Right now it doesn't seem to work though. Output of `RUST_LOG=probe_rs=DEBUG cargo run -p probe-rs --example ram_download -- --address 0x20000000 --size 16 > out.txt 2>&1`:

[out-example.txt](https://github.com/probe-rs/probe-rs/files/4246980/out-example.txt)

@Yatekii

title: Add support for DWARF requires-register evaluation
body:
While testing the fixed back-traces for Cortex-M, I ran into a problem with missing support for debug data which requires the value of a register.

This PR adds support for that, and also removes some usage of unwrap.

title: Initial implementation of new register description
body:
Initial implementation of a more generic way to describe registers.

The goal is to have a struct which works for different platforms, at least RISCV and ARM.

The code of the ARM cores itself is not yet fully adapted right now.

title: Add JLink and Riscv support
body:
In-progress PR to add support for JLink and Riscv.

Currently, connecting to the Chip and halting it works.

title: Add source breakpoints
body: Add initial support to set a breakpoint based on source code location.

Updates the requirements on [rustyline](https://github.com/kkawakam/rustyline) to permit the latest version.

Breaking Changes

  • Input validation (#311, #180, #79) In case you have implemented your own Helper, you will have to make it derive Validator.

title: Update goblin requirement from 0.1.3 to 0.2.0 in /probe-rs

labels.name: category:dependencies
labels.description: Pull requests that update a dependency file

body:
Updates the requirements on [goblin](https://github.com/m4b/goblin) to permit the latest version.
Changelog

Sourced from goblin's changelog.

[0.2.0] - 2020-1-20

Changed

  • BREAKING: Changes in elf::gnu_hash::GnuHash:
    • new(*const u32, usize, &[sym::Sym]) -> Self to from_raw_table(&[u8], &[Sym]) -> Result<Self, &str>
    • find(&self, &str, u32, &Strtab) -> Option<&Sym> to find(&self, &str, &Strtab) -> Option<&Sym>.
  • BREAKING: mach: fix generic relocation constants, @philipc: m4b/goblin#204

Added

  • elf: add more elf note values, thanks @xcoldhandsx: m4b/goblin#201
  • finally rustfmt'd entire repo :D

[0.1.3] - 2019-12-28

Removed

  • alloc feature, stabilized in 1.36 @philipc m4b/goblin#196

Added

elf: support empty PT_DYNAMIC references, @jan-auer m4b/goblin#193 elf: move various elf::Sym impls out of alloc gate, @lzutao m4b/goblin#198

Fixed

elf: parsing 0 section header had regression introduced in 779d0ce, fixed by @philipc m4b/goblin#200

[0.1.2] - 2019-12-02

Fixed

mach: don't return data for zerofill sections, @philipc m4b/goblin#195

[0.1.1] - 2019-11-10

Fixed

elf: Don't fail entire elf parse when interpreter is malformed string, @jsgf m4b/goblin#192

[0.1.0] - 2019-11-3

Added

  • update to scroll 0.10 api

Changed

  • BREAKING: rename export to lib in Reexport::DLLOrdinal from @lzybkr
  • pe: only parse ExceptionData for machine X86_64, thanks @wyxloading

Fixed

pe: Fix resolution of redirect unwind info, thanks @jan-auer m4b/goblin#183 pe: fix reexport dll and ordinal, thanks @lzybkr: d62889f469846af0cceb789b415f1e14f5f9e402

[0.0.24] - 2019-7-13

Added

  • archive: new public enum type to determine which kind of archive was parsed

Fixed

  • archive: thanks @raindev
    • fix parsing of windows style archives: m4b/goblin#174
    • stricter parsing of archives with multiple indexes: m4b/goblin#175

[0.0.23] - 2019-6-30

... (truncated)
Commits
  • See full diff in compare view

title: Update gimli requirement from 0.19.0 to 0.20.0 in /probe-rs

labels.name: category:dependencies
labels.description: Pull requests that update a dependency file

body:
Updates the requirements on [gimli](https://github.com/gimli-rs/gimli) to permit the latest version.
Changelog

Sourced from gimli's changelog.

0.20.0

Released 2020/01/11.

Breaking changes

  • Changed type of DwTag, DwAt, and DwForm constants. #451

  • Added read/write::AttributeValue::DebugMacroRef, and returned where required in read::Attribute::value. Added SectionId::DebugMacro. #454

  • Deleted alloc feature, and fixed no-std builds with stable rust. #459

  • Deleted read::Error::description, and changed <read::Error as Display> to display what was previously the description. #462

Added

  • Added GNU view constants. #434

  • Added read::EntriesRaw for low level DIE parsing. #455

  • Added examples/simple-line.rs. #460

Fixed

  • Fixed handling of CFI augmentations without data. #438

  • dwarfdump: fix panic for malformed expressions. #447

  • dwarfdump: fix handling of Mach-O relocations. #449

Changed

  • Improved abbreviation parsing performance. #451

0.19.0

... (truncated)
Commits
  • 7405536 Merge pull request #467 from philipc/release
  • c0c11c7 Bump version to 0.20.0
  • 8d48b0f Update changelog
  • 30131d8 Merge pull request #466 from philipc/deps

  • acf9f74 Update dependencies

  • f078597 remove deprecated Error::description
  • 8728e82 Fix features for examples/simple_line

title: Refactor daplink specific errors
body: Instead of mapping DAPlink specific error to the `DebugProbeError::UnknownError`, we can wrap them into a `ProbeSpecific` error, so that they don't get lost.

title: Add stm32f0 support
body: Tested on stm32f042g6

title: Refactor probe error handling, especially regarding st-link
body:
Move ST-Link specific errors to a ST-Link specific error type,
to clean up the DebugProbeError type.

The rental crate is also removed, to simply the implementation of
the ST-Link support.

title: Support different flash sector sizes
body:
This PR fixes and improves the M4 flashing with the STM cores.

The issues basically stemmed from us interpreting the .pdsc format wrong and not accounting for subFamilies.

This PR also makes the yaml files store the flash blob in base64 encoded form to save storage.

title: usb PID added for Nucleo64 stm32f411re
Add probe open helper functions
body:
Add some helper functions to the `MasterProbe` struct, which makes it easier to select a debug probe to use.

Also fix a small bug, where a debug probe was selected automatically even though multiple probes are connected.

title: Split code generation into separate crate
body:
Code generation is now done by the probe-rs-t2rust crate, which
makes it easier to run it separately to inspect the output.

The generated code is now also formatted with rustfmt, to improve
error messages.

title: Fix breakpoint setting for Cortex-M4
body: As discussed, this fixes break point settings for Cortex-M4.

title: Add a flag to disable progressbars
Add STM32F4 targets
body:
The STM32F412ZG target has been tested a bit, the others not yet. Created from the .pdsc file provided by ST. 

Auto-detection works for the STM32F1412ZG.

title: Add support for multiple breakpoints
body: Currently, only a single hardware breakpoint is supported. This PR adds support for as many HW breakpoints as the device supports.

title: Ad
body: Add propaganda :P

title: Fix the automatic chip detection
body:
During the rewrite of probe-rs targets for automatic CMSIS-Pack usage, the automatic chip detection broke. This has been fixed.

Furthermore, the error messages have been improved to properly report that the chip detection was unfruitful.

title: impl basic gdb server to actually use probe-rs
Use block transfer
body: Use the [TransferBlock](https://www.keil.com/pack/doc/CMSIS/DAP/html/group__DAP__TransferBlock.html) function for reads and writes of blocks of memory, which increases speed about by a factor of 10.

title: Add cargo flash example to README
Add progress bars to cargo-flash
body:
I finally added some progress bars.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/529795/71427423-be7e2f00-26b8-11ea-8fe8-1b095745b975.png)

The code is not the nicest and I am not sure if more feedback on the stats is wanted.

I am happy about any feedback :)

Merry Christmas
Yatekii

title: Resturcture modules
body: This should fix some of the broken module logic.

title: Add initial support for Cortex-M33
body:
Most of the code is based on the M0, with some small adaptions
to the register definitions.

Support for hardware breakpoints is not yet implemented.

title: Remove potential endless loop, and cleanup Core trait a bit.
body:
This removes a potential endless loop, which could have happened in the `reset_and_halt` function, which was waiting for the core to reset without a timeout.

All functions in the `Core` trait which halt the core now return the `CoreInformation` struct, to make the interface more consistent. The `CoreInformation` struct is also renamed from `CpuInformation`, and placed next to the `Core` trait, where it is actually used.

title: First draft of the config structure for cmsis pack based flashing configuration
body:
Ok, so I made a small draft of how I imagine hwo we could do this.
Please add your ideas and hints, I'll gladly incooperate them.

I suggest a config file structure like this:

```
$HOME/.config/probe-rs
    - repositories.yaml
    - repositories
        - foo
            - svd
                - chip_name.svd
            - algorithms
                - algorithm_name.yaml
            - targets
                - chip_name.yaml
            - .git
```

The `chip_name.yaml` contains a chip definition which links to an algorithm (by name).
It also contains a list of chip variants which all describe their memory layout.

The target can be selected with cargo-flash via `cargo flash --target target_name::variant_name` or `cargo flash --target target_name` which will select the first best variant it can find for the target.

To update the repositories we provide a command in cargo-flash too. Which will pull in the repository contents via the git URL provided in the `repositories.yaml`.

To not depend on a server, we ship a binary blob with a select set of sanitized configs, which will be placed in the probe.rs config dir at first run.

To extract the target descriptions we provide a tool too, which can parse the packs and generate the configs.

Maybe we should also not leave the algorithms separate as it just makes config management harder.
So we would just have the target configs.

The algorithm for target selection I imagine is:
- Parse all the target configs from the repositories.
- The ones with higher priorities overwrite the ones with lower priorities (I would take the order of the repository urls).
- The user can directly provide a config file via `--config` (or similar) which always wins in priority.
- The parsed targets are inserted into a list/hashmap from which the target then is selected by name.

I hope this covers it pretty well.

This PR should fix the broken flashbuilder which would only ever add one page to a sector which is ofc wrong but would work for most small blinky examples.

This is also a good step towards removing convoluted pyOCD logic :)

title: Fix read/write_block32 for more than 256 words
body:
From the specs ADI v5 C2.2.2:
> Automatic address increment is only guaranteed to operate on the 10
> least significant bits of the address that is held in the TAR.

So whenever these 10 bit overflow we need to write the TAR again.

title: Improve cargo-flash error handling
body:
This gets rid of all the unwraps, moves error printing to a single spot, and makes errors look like Cargo ones.

This required adding yet another error type and error variants. We should try to remove some of them, or at least switch to a crate that makes us write less boilerplate.

title: Fix cli run command in the readme
body: Quick fix that will help folks get started!

title: Add feature to unlock nRF52 micros
body:
Nordic has a protection scheme where you can completely lock the MEMAP (AP#0), when that happens the only way to unlock the chip is using the CTRL-AP (AP#1) which has a custom set of registers. For more information see: https://infocenter.nordicsemi.com/index.jsp?topic=%2Fcom.nordic.infocenter.nrf52832.ps.v1.1%2Fdif.html&anchor=debugandtrace

I don't see a reason why this wouldn't work for st-link, but it doesn't. It's only working with dap-link. This is kinda weird, because when the chip isn't locked I can use st-link to successfully communicate with AP#1 and send an erase (unlock) command with no problem, and it works, I know that because the flash gets indeed erased. However, when the chip is locked the stlink only gets the `0x05` error (`JtagNoDeviceConnected`) when communicating with the CTRL-AP, while the dap-link works without a problem.

I tried several init configurations for the st-link without success. I also tried using the `STLink::open_ap` method, which lacks documentation and is never used, so I'm not sure when to use it.

title: Run CI on all Pull Requests
Only remove `flash` argument when it's present
body: This makes `cargo-flash` usable without passing `flash` to mimick Cargo, so `probe-rs/target/debug/cargo-flash --bin my_binary` now just works.

title: Run rustfmt
body:
I am not happy with import formatting since it is obviously the worst choice of formatting they have atm.
Also I would love reordering and grouping of imports. Atm I always have to do this manually.

All three options are still unstable.

Also, commas after match blocks make everything more readable. Unfortunately this is unstable too.

I hope they fix the few non sane defaults soon :) Until then, I gotta suffer :D

Yeah I am really not happy with clippy making suggestions which actually change the logic of the code.

scan them manually.

It needs to be tested with more targets.

title: Simplify RomTable handling so we get some proper data output
body: Signed-off-by: Daniel Egger <daniel@eggers-club.de>

title: Set necessary bits for AHB Bus access
body:
To read the ROM table on a STM32F4 (with AHB Bus), it is necessary to set some bits in the CSW register in the Memory AP. The PROT / CACHE bits have to be set correctly. They are defined in the ARM Debug Interface Architecture Specification, Appendix E.

So far this pull reuests sets the correct bits so that reading the ROM table works on both the micro:bit, as well as now also on the STM32F412G-DISCO board.

Open Todos:

- [x] Set these bits in all memory accesses in the adi_v5_memory_interface module
- [ ] Set the bits only if the memory AP is actually connected to an AHB bus.

title: No crates
body: This PR removes all the different crates in probe-rs and merges them into one.
